Package game.quoridor

Class QuoridorGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.quoridor.QuoridorGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Game<QuoridorPlayer,​QuoridorAction>, Drawable
    public final class QuoridorGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements Game<QuoridorPlayer,​QuoridorAction>, Drawable
    Represents the two player version of the Quoridor game.

                                         PlaceObject candidate,
                                         java.util.List<WallObject> walls,
                                         QuoridorPlayer[] players)
        Returns true if the move is valid from the specified current position to the specified candidate position, regarding the specified walls and players.

        candidate - check move to
        walls - to be considered
        players - to be considered
        Returns:
        true if the move is valid.

      • checkWall

        public static boolean checkWall​(WallObject candidate,
                                java.util.List<WallObject> walls,
                                QuoridorPlayer[] players)
        Returns true if the specified candidate wall can be placed on the board, regarding the specified walls and players. Walls can not be crossed by each other, and players can not be blocked from reaching the target position.
        Parameters:
        candidate - to be checked
        walls - considered walls
        players - considered players
        Returns:
        true if the wall can be placed.

      • pathExists

        public static boolean pathExists​(java.util.List<WallObject> walls,
                                 QuoridorPlayer[] players,
                                 int color)
        Returns true if the player identified by the specified color from the specified players can reach its destination and not blocked by the specified walls.
        Parameters:
        walls - considered walls
        players - players on the board
        color - identifies the player
        Returns:
        true if the player is not blocked.

      • getBoard

        public static int[][] getBoard​(java.util.List<WallObject> walls,
                               QuoridorPlayer[] players)
        Returns a 2D array board representation based on the specified game objects. The size of the result is 2*HEIGHT-1 X 2*WIDTH-1. The odd rows and columns are reserved for walls, the evens are places where players can be on.
        Parameters:
        walls - walls on the board
        players - players on the board
        Returns:
        2D array representation

      • getState

        public static java.lang.String getState​(java.util.List<WallObject> walls,
                                        QuoridorPlayer[] players,
                                        int[] availableWalls,
                                        int currentPlayer)
        Returns the Forsyth–Edwards Notation like string representation of the board defined by the specified objects.
        Parameters:
        walls - walls on the board
        players - players on the board
        availableWalls - remaining walls of the players
        currentPlayer - active player
        Returns:
        Forsyth–Edwards Notation representation
